<div class="p-rich_text_section">…so exactly the same as the regular work era. Have a great weekend, folks. </div>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GIG ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/20/uber-lyfts-big-california-decision-delayed-court?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What Does This California Court Have Against Brew Writers?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Ride-hailing car stuck in place" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTY3L3JpZGUtaGFpbGluZ19jYXJfc3R1Y2tfaW5fcGxhY2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Uber and Lyft’s conflict with the state of California seemed to reach a major turning point...and then doubled back, sending us scrambling to rewrite this story. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Part 1: </strong>Lyft announced plans to <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/20/lyft-will-suspend-service-in-california-after-ordered-to-classify-drivers-as-employees.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suspend its operations</a> in the state as of midnight PT. That’s a huge deal, since California accounted for 16% of Lyft’s rides before the pandemic. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Part 2: </strong>A few hours later, an appeals court extended a deadline, allowing the companies to push the decision off for a few days. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory...</strong>is Tarantino movie-long, and starts from the ride-hailing companies’ earliest days as gig economy pioneers. Back then they prioritized superspeed growth, signing up drivers en masse—but teetered on the fringes of the law. They hoped to dominate markets before regulators could find their keys. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then in 2019, California passed a law known as AB5, which required ridesharing companies to classify their drivers as employees, rather than contractors. That would force Uber and Lyft to provide drivers benefits such as minimum wage and overtime pay.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The companies’ POV </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lyft and Uber argue that they’re in the tech biz, not the transportation biz, so drivers don’t serve their “core” functions and therefore shouldn’t be subject to AB5. Plus, they say the reclassification would upend their operations in ways they can’t be expected to accommodate. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Uber </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/uber-and-lyft-threaten-california-shutdown-heres-whats-at-stake-11597847808?mod=hp_lead_pos6&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">says</a></span><span> that under AB5, it could only employ about a quarter of the drivers it does now. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s also not a great time for a pivot. Both companies’ rideshare revenues are in the junkyard because of the pandemic. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The legal system sees it differently</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In May, CA Attorney General Xavier Becerra sued Lyft and Uber to force them to comply with AB5. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Last week, a judge sided with Becerra and gave Lyber a 10-day window (that would have ended today) to get up to code. They filed for an appeal and threatened to shut down in the state. Yesterday, an appeals court extended that window to August 25. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The companies may still shut down statewide, it’ll just happen next week.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
2020
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/20/joe-biden-accepts-democratic-nomination?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Uncle Joe No More
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Joe Biden" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTY0L2pvZV9iaWRlbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>OLIVIER DOULIERY/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’ll be Democratic Nominee for President Mr. Joseph Robinette Biden, from now on. Last night, Biden formally accepted his party’s nomination for the White House at the Democratic National Convention. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s Wall Street think? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Investors know <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/07/09/889347429/biden-counters-trumps-america-first-with-build-back-better-economic-plan?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Biden’s economic plan</a> has some tough-on-business policies, including returning the corporate tax rate to 28%, upping capital gains taxes, and eliminating a popular real estate tax break.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But it’s not all bad for biz.</strong> Biden’s proposed a $700 billion “Buy American” campaign and a $2 trillion clean energy and infrastructure plan. Investors feeling good about his chances have flocked to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/green-energy-shares-rise-along-with-joe-bidens-polling-11597914012?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">clean-energy stocks</a>, with some companies hitting all-time highs. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Others like his experience navigating recessions. Biden <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/04/06/828303824/a-look-back-at-how-joe-biden-managed-the-2009-stimulus-package?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">oversaw the 2009 Recovery Act</a>, which included tax cuts and unemployment support. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Big Business in general is favoring Dems this year. Of the nearly $800 million donated to candidates by banks, real estate companies, securities firms, and their employees through June 30, over half </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/08/17/902626429/wall-streets-big-money-is-betting-on-biden-and-democrats-in-2020?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">went to Democrats</a></span><span>—the first time they’ve outearned Republicans since 2008, according to the Center for Responsive Politics. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Wall Street is most worried about a disputed election, which could cause volatility for weeks. In 2000, the S&P fell 8.4% between Election Day and Al Gore’s December concession.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
JOBS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/20/jobless-claims-rise-1m?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Jobs Missed the Stock Market’s Memo
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Jobless claims chart for August" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTY4L2pvYmxlc3NfY2xhaW1zX2NoYXJ0X2Zvcl9hdWd1c3QuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/jobless-claims-climb-back-above-1-million-2020-08-20" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">MarketWatch</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Labor Department reported first-time jobless claims <a href="https://apnews.com/bcab5f132b190c5c2b61a750cce33343?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased to 1.1 million</a> last week, a report that sent economists straight from coffee to Irish coffee.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The week prior was the first time claims dipped below 1 million since March.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It was the 22nd consecutive week claims </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/JustinWolfers/status/1296427854406864900?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">exceeded</a></span><span> those during the </span><span><em>worst</em></span><span> week of the Great Recession.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Every cloud has a silver lining.</strong> The total number of Americans collecting unemployment fell from 15.5 million to 14.8 million, the lowest since early April. And sectors like manufacturing, auto sales, and housing are bouncing back. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But...it’s still a cloud. Yesterday’s numbers are a reminder the job market’s road to recovery is going to feel like the last three miles before a rest stop. Unemployment’s at 10.2%, and the nearly 9.3 million jobs added over the last three months are nowhere near the 22 million lost between March and April. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sensing pessimism in the air, the IRS shared its own <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-20/millions-of-u-s-jobs-to-be-lost-for-years-irs-projections-show?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">updated forecasts</a> predicting 37.2 million fewer employee-classified jobs next year. It revised 2027 numbers (the furthest out it’ll even try predicting) down nearly 16 million. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WEATHER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/20/nasty-weather-threatens-populations-across-globe?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Mother Nature Is Angry
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="California lightning" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTY2L2NhbGlmb3JuaWFfbGlnaHRuaW5nLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Justin Sullivan/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At least 349,000 acres (about 546 square miles) have <a href="https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2020-08-20/evacuations-widen-bay-area-fires-threaten-san-jose?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">burned</a> across California as dozens of wildfires force evacuations, destroy buildings, and threaten communities—including in wine country. The fires are a result of what the AP <a href="https://j7dfh9pbumnyhazfmcsfgm9m.apnews.com/b7f6ffc940c843b937d5573b58e2bda7?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">calls</a> an “unprecedented lightning siege” of nearly 11,000 strikes in a few days. <a href="https://activenorcal.com/15-insane-photos-from-northern-californias-2-day-lightning-storm/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">See some crazy pictures</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Meanwhile, in China...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTY1L3RocmVlX2dvcmdlc19kYW0uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIn0=" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Nie Shuang/VCG via Getty Images</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Water levels at the monstrous Three Gorges Dam reached their <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/aug/20/china-three-gorges-dam-highest-level-hydro-electric-floods?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">highest levels ever</a> following months of downpours in the region. Extreme flooding has led to the displacement of over a million people and caused billions of dollars in direct economic damage.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we’re here:</strong> The dam, a highly controversial but remarkable engineering achievement, has a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_Gorges_Dam?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Wikipedia entry</a> worth skimming.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

COMMUNITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/20/can-think-funny-headline-taco-bells-new-restaurant-concept?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last week, we asked Brew readers to come up with funny headlines for AMC's decision to charge 15 cents per movie when it reopened theaters yesterday (btw, did anyone take advantage?).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The headlines were hilarious and the feedback was overwhelmingly positive, so we thought, hey, let’s run it back.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This week’s story</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Taco Bell just released its latest restaurant concept, “<a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/20/taco-bell-unveils-new-design-with-more-drive-thrus-as-pandemic-permanently-shifts-how-we-order.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Go Mobile</a>,” that’s catered to the pandemic era. It’ll include two drive-thru lanes, parking spaces designated for curbside pickup, and advanced tech execs compared it to an air traffic control room. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTYzL3RhY29fYmVsbF9yZXN0YXVyYW50X2NvbmNlcHQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIn0=" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Taco Bell</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Feeling inspired? <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/IDg5CRLx?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Share your headline here</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">P.S. </strong>We award points for originality, so if a digestion-centered headline popped into your head...it probably did for everyone else, too.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Written by
<a href="https://twitter.com/Neal_Freyman" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Neal Freyman</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/its_ahickey" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Alex Hickey</a>, and <a href="https://twitter.com/ElizaCarter34" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Eliza Carter</a>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nGIG ECONOMY \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/20/uber-lyfts-big-california-decision-delayed-court?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWhat Does This California Court Have Against Brew Writers?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Ride-hailing car stuck in place\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTY3L3JpZGUtaGFpbGluZ19jYXJfc3R1Y2tfaW5fcGxhY2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Uber and Lyft’s conflict with the state of California seemed to reach a major turning point...and then doubled back, sending us scrambling to rewrite this story. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePart 1: \u003c/strong\u003eLyft announced plans to \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/20/lyft-will-suspend-service-in-california-after-ordered-to-classify-drivers-as-employees.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuspend its operations\u003c/a\u003e in the state as of midnight PT. That’s a huge deal, since California accounted for 16% of Lyft’s rides before the pandemic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePart 2: \u003c/strong\u003eA few hours later, an appeals court extended a deadline, allowing the companies to push the decision off for a few days. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory...\u003c/strong\u003eis Tarantino movie-long, and starts from the ride-hailing companies’ earliest days as gig economy pioneers. Back then they prioritized superspeed growth, signing up drivers en masse—but teetered on the fringes of the law. They hoped to dominate markets before regulators could find their keys. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThen in 2019, California passed a law known as AB5, which required ridesharing companies to classify their drivers as employees, rather than contractors. That would force Uber and Lyft to provide drivers benefits such as minimum wage and overtime pay.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe companies’ POV \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLyft and Uber argue that they’re in the tech biz, not the transportation biz, so drivers don’t serve their “core” functions and therefore shouldn’t be subject to AB5. Plus, they say the reclassification would upend their operations in ways they can’t be expected to accommodate. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eUber \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/uber-and-lyft-threaten-california-shutdown-heres-whats-at-stake-11597847808?mod=hp_lead_pos6\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esays\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that under AB5, it could only employ about a quarter of the drivers it does now. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s also not a great time for a pivot. Both companies’ rideshare revenues are in the junkyard because of the pandemic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe legal system sees it differently\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn May, CA Attorney General Xavier Becerra sued Lyft and Uber to force them to comply with AB5. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLast week, a judge sided with Becerra and gave Lyber a 10-day window (that would have ended today) to get up to code. They filed for an appeal and threatened to shut down in the state. Yesterday, an appeals court extended that window to August 25. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe companies may still shut down statewide, it’ll just happen next week.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F08%2F20%2Fuber-lyfts-big-california-decision-delayed-court\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 25px\" width=\"25\" src=\"https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=The+roots+of+this+conflict+lie+in+the+companies%E2%80%99+DNA+\u0026url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/20/uber-lyfts-big-california-decision-delayed-court\u0026via=MorningBrew\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTY0L2pvZV9iaWRlbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eOLIVIER DOULIERY/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat’ll be Democratic Nominee for President Mr. Joseph Robinette Biden, from now on. Last night, Biden formally accepted his party’s nomination for the White House at the Democratic National Convention. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s Wall Street think? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInvestors know \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/07/09/889347429/biden-counters-trumps-america-first-with-build-back-better-economic-plan?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBiden’s economic plan\u003c/a\u003e has some tough-on-business policies, including returning the corporate tax rate to 28%, upping capital gains taxes, and eliminating a popular real estate tax break.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut it’s not all bad for biz.\u003c/strong\u003e Biden’s proposed a $700 billion “Buy American” campaign and a $2 trillion clean energy and infrastructure plan. Investors feeling good about his chances have flocked to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/green-energy-shares-rise-along-with-joe-bidens-polling-11597914012?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclean-energy stocks\u003c/a\u003e, with some companies hitting all-time highs. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOthers like his experience navigating recessions. Biden \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/04/06/828303824/a-look-back-at-how-joe-biden-managed-the-2009-stimulus-package?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoversaw the 2009 Recovery Act\u003c/a\u003e, which included tax cuts and unemployment support. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBig Business in general is favoring Dems this year. Of the nearly $800 million donated to candidates by banks, real estate companies, securities firms, and their employees through June 30, over half \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/08/17/902626429/wall-streets-big-money-is-betting-on-biden-and-democrats-in-2020?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewent to Democrats\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e—the first time they’ve outearned Republicans since 2008, according to the Center for Responsive Politics. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWall Street is most worried about a disputed election, which could cause volatility for weeks. style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Labor Department reported first-time jobless claims \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/bcab5f132b190c5c2b61a750cce33343?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased to 1.1 million\u003c/a\u003e last week, a report that sent economists straight from coffee to Irish coffee.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe week prior was the first time claims dipped below 1 million since March.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt was the 22nd consecutive week claims \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/JustinWolfers/status/1296427854406864900?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexceeded\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e those during the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eworst\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e week of the Great Recession.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEvery cloud has a silver lining.\u003c/strong\u003e The total number of Americans collecting unemployment fell from 15.5 million to 14.8 million, the lowest since early April. And sectors like manufacturing, auto sales, and housing are bouncing back. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut...it’s still a cloud. Yesterday’s numbers are a reminder the job market’s road to recovery is going to feel like the last three miles before a rest stop. Unemployment’s at 10.2%, and the nearly 9.3 million jobs added over the last three months are nowhere near the 22 million lost between March and April. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSensing pessimism in the air, the IRS shared its own \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-20/millions-of-u-s-jobs-to-be-lost-for-years-irs-projections-show?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eupdated forecasts\u003c/a\u003e predicting 37.2 million fewer employee-classified jobs next year. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAh, the Butt Bulge. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s that bulbous bump
